title: Pacific Maritime Big Book of Bees
text: Created and designed by Cait Harrigan & Kath Quayle

title: Pacific Maritime Big Book of Bees
text:
Observation notes
Bee pages have notes on historical observations curated from literature. See our references page for a complete list of sources.
An observation note is formatted as follows: Author et al., date of publication: (Name of observer), date collected, location collected. For example:

Guzman et al., 2023: (Gielens), 2010, Vancouver Island

title: Xylocopa varipuncta
text: ©️ Enot Poluskuns.

title: Xylocopa varipuncta
text:
Observation notes
OSU Insect Collection: (R.C.Osburn), 1949, Capilano Canyon. Note: this was likely a failed introduction of the species and that if the record is valid, that it has not established or been detected since. It is a more southern species, which at this time, does not survive outside of the central valley of California (LR Best, personal communication).

title: Bombus flavifrons
text: ©️ Bob.

title: Bombus flavifrons
text:
Observation notes
First documented by Handlirsch, 1891, with extensive historical record in the Pacific Maritime (see Best list for historical record to 2000). Tommasi et al. 2004: Greater Vancouver Area. Ratti et al. 2008: Fraser Valley. Biodiversity Galiano Life List: (G.G.E. Scudder), 1970, Galiano. Guzman et al., 2023: (Elle), 2005; (Neame), 2007; (Gielens), 2009, 2010; (Wray), 2012; (Gillespie), 2014, 2015; (Kelly), 2017, Vancouver Island. (Button), 2011, Abbotsford; (Gehrels), 2013; (Toshack), 2015; (Bobiwash), 2016, Lower Mainland. NBSBC Bee Atlas Database: (Zand), 2021; (Carmichael), (Nicholls), (Gadzik), 2022, Vancouver Island, Saltspring; (Cruise), (Young), 2022, Lower Mainland, Squamish; (Harrison), (Lakes), 2023, Greater Vancouver; ((Wong), (McDougall), (Lakes), (Lee), Vancouver Island, (Quayle), 2023, Galiano Island. iNaturalist: widespread throughout the Pacific Maritime, from 2008.

title: Bombus fervidus
text:
Observation notes
First documented by Taylor, 1884, with extensive historical record in the Pacific Maritime (see Best list for historical record to 2000). Biodiversity Galiano Life List: (G.G.E. Scudder), 1985, Galiano. Ratti et al. 2008: Fraser Valley. Guzman et al., 2023: (Elle), 2005; (Neame), 2007, Vancouver Island. M. Clausen, Masters thesis: 2017, Delta. Guzman et al., 2023: (Elle), 2005; (Neame), 2007; (Wray), 2012; (Gillespie), 2014, 2015; (Kelly), 2017, Vancouver Island. (Button), 2011, Abbotsford. (Gehrels), 2013; (Toshack), 2015; (Bobiwash), 2016, Lower Mainland. iNaturalist: Vancouver Island, Lower Mainland, Fraser Valley, from 2015. Note: B. californicus and B. fervidus are conspecific, representing two intergrading colour forms.

title: Bombus caliginosus
text: ©️ Ryan Shaw.

title: Bombus caliginosus
text:
Observation notes
Easily confused with Bombus vonesenskii due to almost identical color pattern, but females typically have white hairs on the underside of the abdomen. B. caliginosus is known to Washington state and likely is also present in the Pacific Maritime. See B. vosnesenski for more info.

NBSBC Bee Atlas Database: (Zand), 2021, 2022, 2023; (Gazdik), (Cruise), 2022, ((Wong), (Lakes), (Lee), 2023, Vancouver Island. iNaturalist: widespread throughout the Pacific Maritime, from 1978.

title: Bombus vosnesenskii
text: ©️ Thomas Barbin.

title: Bombus vosnesenskii
text:
Observation notes
Lutz and Cockerell 1920: Vancouver Island. Muesebeck et al. 1951: Pacific coast. Tommasi et al. 2004: Greater Vancouver Area. Ratti et al. 2008: Fraser Valley. Fraser et al. 2012: E. (Elle), L. (Button), C. Ratti, 2004, numerous localities recorded for the Lower Mainland and adjacent Vancouver Island, Cowichan Lake Forestry Station; Abbotsford; Fraser Valley Regional District, Onnink property. Biodiversity Galiano Life List: (Andrew Simon), 2017, Galiano. Guzman et al., 2023: (Neame), 2007; (Gielens), 2009, 2010; (Wray), 2012; (Gillespie), 2014, 2015; (Kelly), 2017, Vancouver Island. (Button), 2011, Abbotsford. (Gehrels), 2013; (Toshack), 2015; (Bobiwash), 2016; (Elle), 2016, Lower Mainland. NBSBC Bee Atlas Database: (Zand), 2021, 2022; (Gadzik), (Young), (Nicholls), (Harrison)), 2022; ((Wong), (Carmichael), (McDougall), (Lee), Vancouver Island; (Lakes), 2023, Vancouver. iNaturalist: Vancouver Island, Lower Mainland, Squamish, from 2007. Note: B. caliginosus is easily overlooked due to similarities with B. vosnesenskii. females can be differentiated from B. vosnesenskii based on the slightly but dictinctly loner malar area, and the extensive pale hairs on S4. Males can be identified gased on the same malar features, and the wider, expanded penis valves (LR Best, personal communication).
